byline.original: By GEORGE ANELSSON Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

snippet: BERLIN, Aug. 1--On the twentysixth anniversary of the outbreak of the World War, which raised no echoes in any Berlin newspaper,...

headline.main: AERIAL WARFARE SLACKENS BUT EACH SIDE RAIDS A CITY; MOLOTOFF SEES U.S. IN WAR; HANOVER IS BOMBED Civilians Chief Victims, Nazis Say--Norwich Similarly Attacked GERMANS IN LEAFLET RAID Both Sides Claim Successes in Striking at Purely Military Objectives

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Aug. 1--On the twentysixth anniversary of the outbreak of the World War, which raised no echoes in any Berlin newspaper,
